businessObject.description: AuditAction stores all actions performed on various processes. It tracks the process name, action type, version, object type, and content, along with the creation date and the user who performed the action, providing a complete audit trail.

field.name: processName
field.description: The name of the process from which the action was initiated.

field.name: actionType
field.description: The type of action performed on the business object, such as 'insert', 'update', or 'delete'.

field.name: processVersion
field.description: The specific version of the process.

field.name: objectType
field.description: The type of the Business Data Model (BDM) object that was affected by the action.

field.name: inputContent
field.description: The input data or parameters used for the executed action.

field.name: auCreationDate
field.description: Date and time this record was created

field.name: auCreationUser
field.description: User who created this record

businessObject.description: This object defines the metadata for an attribute used by a specific action type. Each record describes a unique field with its display name, data type, and a short description. These attributes are aggregated by the MstActionType object to define a complete action.

field.name: fullName
field.description: The unique programmatic name of the attribute (e.g., 'emailTo')

field.name: displayName
field.description: The name to be displayed in the user interface (e.g., 'Email To').

field.name: label
field.description: A more detailed label for the attribute, which can contain HTML for richer formatting.

field.name: shortDescription
field.description: A brief description of the attribute's purpose.

field.name: dataType
field.description: The data type of the attribute, e.g., 'STRING', 'TEXT', 'BOOLEAN'.

field.name: auCreationDate
field.description: The date and time when the attribute record was created.

field.name: auCreationUser
field.description: The username of the user who created the attribute record.

field.name: auModificationDate
field.description: The date and time of the last modification to the attribute record.

field.name: auModificationUser
field.description: The username of the user who performed the last modification.

businessObject.description: This master data object categorizes different types of actions available in the process builder. Each record defines an action type (e.g., 'Email Notification') and aggregates all the MstActionAttribute records that constitute its fields.

field.name: fullName
field.description: The unique programmatic name of the action type (e.g., 'EMAIL_NOTIFICATION').

field.name: displayName
field.description: The human-readable name of the row, primarily used for display in user interfaces. This may differ from fullName if a shorter or more localized version is preferred for presentation.

field.name: label
field.description: A more detailed label for the action type, which can contain HTML for richer formatting.

field.name: shortDescription
field.description: A brief description of the action type's purpose.

relationField.name: refActionAttribute
relationField.description: A collection of all MstActionAttribute records that define the fields for this action type.

field.name: auCreationDate
field.description: The date and time when the record was created.

field.name: auCreationUser
field.description: The username of the user who created the record.

field.name: auModificationDate
field.description: auModificationDate:

field.name: auModificationUser
field.description: The username of the user who performed the last modification.

businessObject.description: This master table defines and categorizes the different types of master entities stored within the MstGenericEntry table. Each record represents a distinct classification (e.g., 'Domain', 'Context', 'Status'), acting as a lookup for the refMstEntityTypeId in MstGenericEntry to identify the specific nature of a generic entry.

field.name: fullName
field.description: A unique, internal, programmatic identifier for the row, used for backend processing and data mapping.

field.name: displayName
field.description: The human-readable name of the master entry, primarily used for display in user interfaces. This may differ from fullName if a shorter or more localized version is preferred for presentation.

field.name: shortDescription
field.description: A concise summary or brief overview of the item.

field.name: auCreationDate
field.description: Date and time this record was created

field.name: auCreationUser
field.description: User who created this record

field.name: auModificationDate
field.description: Date and time this record was last modified

field.name: auModificationUser
field.description: User who last modified this record

businessObject.description: This master table serves as a centralized repository for various types of master data that share a common set of attributes. Each record represents an entry of a specific master entity type (e.g., a Status,...), allowing for standardized management and common auditing across different lookup lists.

field.name: fullName
field.description: A unique, internal, programmatic identifier for the row, used for backend processing and data mapping.

field.name: displayName
field.description: The human-readable name of the master entry, primarily used for display in user interfaces. This may differ from fullName if a shorter or more localized version is preferred for presentation.

field.name: label
field.description: A more detailed label for the row, which can contain HTML for richer formatting.

field.name: shortDescription
field.description: A concise summary or brief overview of the item

relationField.name: refMstEntityType
relationField.description: Reference to the type of master entity (e.g., Domain, Context).

field.name: auCreationDate
field.description: Date and time this record was created

field.name: auCreationUser
field.description: User who created this record

field.name: auModificationDate
field.description: Date and time this record was last modified

field.name: auModificationUser
field.description: User who last modified this record

query.name: findByFullNameAndRefMstEntityTypeId
query.content: SELECT m FROM MstGenericEntry m WHERE LOWER(m.fullName) = LOWER(:fullName) AND m.refMstEntityType.persistenceId = :refMstEntityTypeId ORDER BY m.fullName ASC

query.name: countForFindByFullNameAndRefMstEntityTypeId
query.content: SELECT COUNT(m) FROM MstGenericEntry m WHERE LOWER(m.fullName) = LOWER(:fullName) AND m.refMstEntityType.persistenceId = :refMstEntityTypeId

businessObject.description: It classifies and defines the available input control types for form fieldsor widgets. It provides a standardized and extensible list of field widgets types (e.g., text input, number, date), ensuring consistent form configuration and data validation. Each entry represents a predefined field type that can be assigned to a FormField.

field.name: fullName
field.description: A unique, internal, programmatic identifier for the row, used for backend processing and data mapping.

field.name: displayName
field.description: The human-readable name of the row, primarily used for display in user interfaces. This may differ from fullName if a shorter or more localized version is preferred for presentation.

field.name: label
field.description: A more detailed label for the row, which can contain HTML for richer formatting.

field.name: shortDescription
field.description: A concise summary or brief overview of the item

field.name: regularExpression
field.description: An optional pattern for validating the format of the field's input.

field.name: errorMessage
field.description: The custom message shown to the user if the field's input fails validation.

field.name: encrypted
field.description: A boolean flag indicating whether the data entered into this field should be encrypted.

field.name: maximumValue
field.description: Defines the upper limit for a field. For numbers, it's the highest allowed value. For text, it's the maximum number of characters.

field.name: minimumValue
field.description: Defines the lower limit for a field. For numbers, it's the lowest allowed value. For text, it's the minimum number of characters.

field.name: auCreationDate
field.description: Date and time this record was created

field.name: auCreationUser
field.description: User who created this record

field.name: auModificationDate
field.description: Date and time this record was last modified

field.name: auModificationUser
field.description: User who last modified this record

businessObject.description: A CaseResponse object represents the data entered by a user in a specific form within a process. It captures a single response for a particular form widget.

relationField.name: formWidget
relationField.description: This attribute is a reference to the FormWidget object. It identifies which specific form element (e.g., a text box, a drop-down menu) the user's response belongs to.

field.name: responseValue
field.description: This attribute is a string (STRING) that stores the actual value entered by the user in the corresponding formWidget.

field.name: auCreationDate
field.description: The date and time when the process step record was created.

field.name: auCreationUser
field.description: The username of the user who created the process step record.

field.name: auModificationDate
field.description: The date and time of the last modification to the process step record.

field.name: auModificationUser
field.description: The username of the user who performed the last modification.

businessObject.description: FormSection represents a logical division within a form, grouping related fields or widgets for improved organization, readability, and user experience. Each section has a title and description, acting as a structural component for complex forms and facilitating structured data collection.

field.name: fullName
field.description: A unique, internal, programmatic identifier for the row, used for backend processing and data mapping.

field.name: displayName
field.description: The human-readable name of the row, primarily used for display in user interfaces. This may differ from fullName if a shorter or more localized version is preferred for presentation.

field.name: label
field.description: A more detailed label for the row, which can contain HTML for richer formatting.

field.name: fullDescription
field.description: The fullDescription attribute holds a more detailed explanation or introductory text for the FormSection. It provides additional context, instructions, or a summary of the section's purpose, enhancing user comprehension during form completion.

field.name: displayOrder
field.description: The attribute stores the numerical position of a section within a form. This value determines the visual order in which the section appears on the screen, allowing users to reorder sections and persist their arrangement.

field.name: auCreationDate
field.description: Date and time this record was created

field.name: auCreationUser
field.description: User who created this record

field.name: auModificationDate
field.description: Date and time this record was last modified

field.name: auModificationUser
field.description: User who last modified this record

field.name: auActive
field.description: Indicates whether the form section is currently active or not. 'True' for active, 'False' for inactive.

businessObject.description: It defines the properties and configuration of an individual input field or widget within a FormSection. It specifies how the field or widget behaves, what kind of data it collects, and how it's presented to the user. Each FormWidget is associated with a specific FormSection and is crucial for capturing user input.

field.name: fullName
field.description: A unique, internal, programmatic identifier for the row, used for backend processing and data mapping.

field.name: displayName
field.description: The human-readable name of the row, primarily used for display in user interfaces. This may differ from fullName if a shorter or more localized version is preferred for presentation.

field.name: label
field.description: A more detailed label for the row, which can contain HTML for richer formatting.

relationField.name: refTypeFormWidget
relationField.description: A reference to the predefined input control type for this field, sourced from the MstTypeField master table. This dictates its appearance and validation rules.

field.name: displayOrder
field.description: The attribute stores the numerical position of a field within a section. This value determines the visual order in which the field appears on the screen, allowing users to reorder fields and persist their arrangement.

field.name: placeholder
field.description: Optional instructional text displayed inside an empty input field as a hint.

field.name: readOnly
field.description: The custom message shown to the user if the field's input fails validation.

field.name: required
field.description: A boolean flag indicating whether the data entered into this field should be encrypted.

field.name: auCreationDate
field.description: Date and time this record was created

field.name: auCreationUser
field.description: User who created this record

field.name: auModificationDate
field.description: Date and time this record was last modified

field.name: auModificationUser
field.description: User who last modified this record

field.name: auActive
field.description: Indicates whether the form widget is currently active/visible or not. 'True' for active, 'False' for inactive.

relationField.name: refStatus
relationField.description: Unique identifier linking this process to a high-level business or functional domain, defined in the MstGenericEntry master table - type CaseStatus. Indicates the current operational status of the process (e.g., whether it's open, pending, canceled, closed, etc.).

field.name: processInstanceId
field.description: This is a unique identifier (LONG) for a running instance of a business process (Bonita BPM Process Id). It is used to track and manage a specific case as it progresses through its various stages.

relationField.name: refCaseResponses
relationField.description: This field is a reference to one or more CaseResponse objects. Meaning it can hold a collection of responses associated with a specific process instance.

field.name: auCreationDate
field.description: Date and time this record was created

field.name: auCreationUser
field.description: User who created this record

field.name: auModificationDate
field.description: Date and time this record was last modified

field.name: auModificationUser
field.description: User who last modified this record

field.name: auActive
field.description: Indicates whether the form section is currently active or not. 'True' for active, 'False' for inactive.

businessObject.description: The ProcessForm object defines the structure and content of a particular form used within a process.

field.name: fullName
field.description: The complete, descriptive name of the form.

field.name: displayName
field.description: The human-readable name of the row, primarily used for display in user interfaces. This may differ from fullName if a shorter or more localized version is preferred for presentation.

relationField.name: refFormSection
relationField.description: A collection of references to FormSection objects, representing the various sections that compose this form.

field.name: auCreationDate
field.description: Date and time this record was created

field.name: auCreationUser
field.description: User who created this record

field.name: auModificationDate
field.description: Date and time this record was last modified

field.name: auModificationUser
field.description: User who last modified this record

field.name: auActive
field.description: Indicates the current operational status of the record: True if active and usable, False if inactive or disabled.

businessObject.description: The ProcessParameter object represents an individual configuration parameter for a process. It is used to store specific configuration data. Each ProcessParameter is associated with a parent ProcessSpecification, allowing for flexible and extensible configuration for each process.

field.name: fullName
field.description: The complete, official name of an entity

field.name: displayName
field.description: A user-friendly name for the process, optimized for display in user interfaces. It may be a shorter or more localized version of the process name.

field.name: version
field.description: The version identifier for this specific process definition. Used to track changes and distinguish between different iterations.

field.name: shortDescription
field.description: A detailed description providing comprehensive information about the purpose and scope of this process.

field.name: appName
field.description: Name of the application to which the process is associated.

field.name: autoCancellationDays
field.description: The number of days after which an inactive process instance will be automatically cancelled or abandoned. A value of 0 means no automatic cancellation.

field.name: documentsFolderPath
field.description: The system path or identifier for the root folder where all documents attached to instances of this process will be stored.

field.name: auCreationDate
field.description: Date and time this record was created

field.name: auCreationUser
field.description: User who created this record

field.name: auModificationDate
field.description: Date and time this record was last modified

field.name: auModificationUser
field.description: User who last modified this record

businessObject.description: Object represents the main configuration and metadata for a complete business process. This object holds global properties of the process, and other essential configuration parameters that define the process's behavior.

relationField.name: refProcessParameter
relationField.description: This field is a reference to a ProcessParameter object. However, the image shows it within the ProcessSpecification object, and the description for ProcessSpecification states that it "represents the main configuration and metadata for a complete business process." Therefore, refProcessParameter likely refers to a global parameter that is configured for the entire process.

relationField.name: refStatus
relationField.description: Unique identifier linking this process to a high-level business or functional domain, defined in the MstGenericEntry master table - type ProcessStatus. Indicates the current operational status of the process (e.g., whether it's running, stopped, etc.).

relationField.name: refProcessStep
relationField.description: This is a reference to a ProcessStep object. It likely defines a collection of all the possible steps or tasks that are part of the overall business process. It confirms that a single process specification can have a list of several process steps, not just one.

field.name: auCreationDate
field.description: The date and time when the process step record was created.

field.name: auCreationUser
field.description: The username of the user who created the process step record.

field.name: auModificationDate
field.description: The date and time of the last modification to the process step record.

field.name: auModificationUser
field.description: The username of the user who performed the last modification.

field.name: auActive
field.description: Indicates the current operational status of the record: True if active and usable, False if inactive or disabled.

businessObject.description: Represents a step or a stage within a business process. Each step can have associated actions, such as sending notifications, filling out forms, adding documents, or conditional redirects.

field.name: title
field.description: The title or name of the process step.

field.name: technicalReference
field.description: A unique technical identifier for the process step, often used for programmatic access or integration.

field.name: longDescription
field.description: A detailed description or explanation of the purpose of the process step.

field.name: executionOrder
field.description: The attribute stores the numerical position of a step within a process. This value determines the order in which it is executed and the order in which the step appears on the screen, allowing users to reorder the steps as needed.

field.name: auCreationDate
field.description: The date and time when the process step record was created.

field.name: auCreationUser
field.description: The username of the user who created the process step record.

field.name: auModificationDate
field.description: The date and time of the last modification to the process step record.

field.name: auModificationUser
field.description: The username of the user who performed the last modification.

field.name: auActive
field.description: Indicates whether the process step is currently active or not. 'True' for active, 'False' for inactive.

businessObject.description: Represents a single action to be executed within a process step. Each ProcessStep can have a list of these actions, executed in a defined order. This object is designed to hold core configuration fields and references to other objects that are common across multiple action types.

field.name: executionOrder
field.description: The order in which this action should be executed within the process step.

relationField.name: refAction
relationField.description: This object links a process step to a specific action type

relationField.name: refProcessForm
relationField.description: A reference to the form to be completed. This field is used only when actionType is 'FILL_FORM'.

field.name: auCreationDate
field.description: The date and time when the process step record was created.

field.name: auModificationDate
field.description: The date and time of the last modification to the process step record.

field.name: auModificationUser
field.description: The username of the user who performed the last modification.

field.name: auActive
field.description: Indicates whether the process step action is currently active or not. 'True' for active, 'False' for inactive.
